utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’ll never believe what happened to me at work today.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This old guy was choking on his food, and I saved his life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding. Did you Heimlich him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I said, oh, my God, I think that old guy’s choking, and then one of the busboys Heimlich’ed him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re a hero.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that was the point of the story.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, speaking of work, do you know if you have Thursday night off?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, I think so. Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean, why? It’s Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, right. Yeah, we can do something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You could be a little more into it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I’m into it, I’m into it. Just, there’s so much pressure to make the night special, and it never works out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, this time it’s going to be different. Because I am like a romance ninja. You don’t see it coming, and then bam, romance, watch out, hearts, kisses, love, ooh-ya!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, sometimes I think I’ve made you so much cooler than you used to be, and then you go and do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, in conclusion, I believe the painful sensation felt after passing a meal of spicy chillies is proof that the rectum does possess the sense of taste.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I concur, but you changed the subject. What are we doing for Valentine’s Day?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you caught that, did you?

utterance.speaker: Howard (on phone)
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay! Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie’s a little cranky since she’s been working, like, 17 hours a day. And I’ve got a lot on my plate, too, because I’ve been busting my tail playing Assassin’s Creed.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart, you got anything going on for Valentine’s Day?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Not really. Other than hiding all the sharp objects around here and white-knuckling it till morning. What do you got going on?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, well, I was going to spend the night with my special little lady, but, uh, she got worms, and then I had to take her to the vet.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: There must be something we can do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, uh, how about you keep the store open late, and we throw a party for all the people who don’t have dates?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, the theme will be that the greatest love a man can have is the love he has with himself.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That’s good. Or maybe something a little less hand in the pants.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, Alex, excellent. I have a research problem that I believe you can help with.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Oh, Dr. Cooper, thank you. I’ve been waiting for an opportunity to contribute to your scientific work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. That’s not going to happen, no. What I need you to do is find a Valentine’s gift for my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: You realize I passed up an opportunity to work at Fermilab to take this job with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I guess those chaps will have to have someone else buy their girlfriends presents. Now, here is, let’s see, this is, this is about two thousand dollars, um, I think she likes monkeys and the colour grey. Contribute to my work. Ah, kids say the darnedest things.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you coming to lunch?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, one second. Come here. I want to show you something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What you looking at?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I was trying to come up with something really romantic to give Bernadette for Valentine’s Day since she’s been such a pain in the ass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can’t find a card that says that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out. I used the atomic force microscope in the material science lab and wrote our initials in a heart one one-thousandth the size of a grain of sand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A micro-valentine for a microbiologist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: From her micro-husband. That is amazing. How long did this take you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mmm, about twelve hours. I pulled an all-nighter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, wow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, it really took a bite out of my video game time. What are you and Penny doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’m going to take her to a nice restaurant for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s not bad, but as far as romance goes, I think my gift hits it right out of…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Want to come to dinner with us?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, please.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Amy will be here shortly, expecting the perfect Valentine’s gift, so, you’re up kid. Dazzle me. Go.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Okay, I think I have some really great choices. I went on Amy’s Facebook page and read up on her interests.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, see, I never would have thought to do that. Clearly, I made a good choice farming this out to you. But I am telling you, Amy hit the boyfriend jackpot. Anyway, my socks are on. Let’s knock them off.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Well, um, I know she loves playing the harp, so I found this beautiful music box that plays one of her favourite songs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, Amy already has a real harp. And it can play any song. What are you trying to pull here?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: No, I just thought it would be…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Next.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Okay. Um, I know she’s a fan of The Canterbury Tales.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: So I found this cool map that illustrates the character’s journey through England. I thought we could put it in a really nice frame.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But she’s got Google Maps on her phone.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: I don’t know how to respond to that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I hope it’s with a third good option, because these first two, buh.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Okay. Well, uh, luckily, I saved the best for last. Since Amy’s a neuroscientist, I did some research and found out that Santiago Ramon y Cajal, the father of modern neuroscience, did lots of hand drawings of brain cells. And I managed to find this signed print.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow. Oh, this is truly remarkable.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think I’ll keep it for myself.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: What about your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s too late. I call dibs.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This place is really beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Waugh, romance ninja.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry we’re late.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No problem. We just sat down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmm, would you like some wine?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, fill her up. I’ll tell you when to stop.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Terrific. Couldn’t be better.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, bite me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, we can still have a nice night. Just tell me where it is.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe if you did what you said you were going to do, I’d tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, where what is?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She hid my Xbox like I’m a child. Yeah, and my mom got me that for my birthday, so if you don’t give it back, I’m telling.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ve been working late every night. All I asked was that he clean the apartment and do one load of laundry. But did he do it? No. He just kept on playing that stupid game. You like pushing buttons so much, try pushing them on the washing machine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I said I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry doesn’t clean my underpants, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told you, turn them inside out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And I told you to bite me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Trying to have a magical night here, guys.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nothing. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, tell me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s just this guy I used to date.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Until he cheated on me with my friend Gretchen, who’s here with him now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And it looks like she lost a lot of weight, damn it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know it’s not ideal, but don’t let them ruin our night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you’re totally right. She could be skinny ’cause she’s dying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s the spirit.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what, screw them. Our night is going to be way more special than theirs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Oh, you got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: Gretchen
utterance.content: Oh, my God, yes. Of course I’ll marry you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Two can play this game. Penny…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s nice that all the people who are lonely on Valentine’s Day can come here tonight and be together.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m really looking forward to it. In fact, there’s no place I would rather be than here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Except on a date with anybody.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Literally anybody.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, you and I have so much fun hanging out. If you were a girl, all our problems would be solved.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, think about it. We’d hang out, we’d read comic books, we’d see movies. It’d be like the best relationship ever.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That does sound nice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then I’d take you home, slip off your little black dress and just pile-drive you into oblivion.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I can’t believe he’s going to marry the girl he cheated on me with.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Isn’t it kind of nice? I mean, he was with the wrong person, and now he found the right person.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What, so I’m the wrong person? Maybe you want to be with Gretchen, too.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: They do look happy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe tonight. But a year from now, he’ll be crawling under the sink looking for his Xbox. Well, he will.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t we just forget about them and enjoy our Valentine’s Day?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, absolutely. Now they’re doing that phony link-arm-drink thingy. I totally taught him that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought we were letting it go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We were; it’s just, it’s not fair, okay? They’re bad people. It’s not supposed to end happy for them, it’s supposed to end happy for me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, it did end happy for you. You’re here with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, this is getting a little hard to not take personally.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, don’t make this about you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’m not. It’s about you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, whatever, okay? I told you, Valentine’s Day sucks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This one does, and you’re the reason why.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, compared to them, I’m feeling pretty good about us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Me, too. How about we blow off dessert, go home early, I’ll do that laundry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So where’d you hide it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Where you’d never look.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn it, it’s in the washing machine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Happy Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Shall we go to dinner?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hang on. As you know, I had planned a traditional evening of romance and gifts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and as you know, I planned to pretend to enjoy it. I’ve been working on this facial expression all day.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And I appreciate your effort, but upon contemplation, I decided I was being selfish. So, I cancelled our dinner reservations and came up with an even better way to celebrate Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: By doing none of it. No dinner, no romance, no gifts. We stay here, order a pizza and watch one of your beloved Star War Trek things.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, that’s what you’d love, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: More than anything.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, then, that’s what we’re going to do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know what to say. This is the most thoughtful gift that anyone’s ever given me. And that’s including an amazing gift that I gave myself earlier today.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m your girlfriend. That’s my job. And I know gift-giving puts a lot of pressure on you, so whatever you got me, you can return.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No, after everything you didn’t do for me tonight, I want you to have it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Read it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon Cooper, Caltech University employee information?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At the bottom.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: In case of emergency, please contact… Amy Farrah Fowler. And there’s my phone number. This is the most beautiful gift you could’ve ever given me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I thought, if I have a stroke or a kidney stone, who would I want to share that with?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And you picked me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s like you said, you’re my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay. Stop ruining Valentine’s Day and order my pizza.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yep. You know what? That was pretty crappy of you. I mean, all I wanted to do was give you a great night, and it’s like you-you went out of your way to destroy it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I’m a total bitch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not saying that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I am.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, you win. You’re a bitch. Why couldn’t we just have a nice time?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe ’cause things are going so well between us lately and I’ve been really happy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, you’re gonna have to make a lot more sense than that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Obviously, I have some commitment issues.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Glaringly obvious. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: As long as things keep going great between us, you’ll keep asking me to marry you, and eventually I’m gonna end up saying yes, and then we’re gonna be married forever, and the whole thing just freaks me out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. I know I propose a lot. So how about this? I promise I will never ask you to marry me again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What, what do you mean? Are you breaking up with me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. No, no, no, no. But if someday you decide you want to get married, you have to propose to me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes. It’s all on you. But I got to tell you, when the time comes, I want the whole nine yards. I want you down on one knee, flowers, I want to be swept off my feet.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you got it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And I’m cool with surprises. But nothing on a Jumbotron. I don’t want to cry on a big screen like that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. You know what? This might be the wine talking, but I have a very important question to ask you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard Hofstadter?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Will you be my valentine?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry. Maybe next year. I’m just kidding. Romance ninja. Let’s have sex. Waugh!

utterance.speaker: Nerdy guy
utterance.content: Thank you, guys, for doing this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’re glad you could make it.

utterance.speaker: Nerdy guy
utterance.content: Usually I spend Valentine’s Day sad and alone. This year, I’m just sad.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is it about this holiday that makes people so unhappy?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I know. I hate myself most of the time, but tonight’s the night I know everyone else does, too.

utterance.speaker: Nerdy guy
utterance.content: I think you’re cool.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I got to tell you, we’ve got to stop beating ourselves up like this. Excuse me, everybody. Can I have your attention, please? We’re all here tonight because we have no one to be with. But that doesn’t make us mutants. The only mutants here are in these comic books. We’ve got to stop defining our self-worth by whether or not we’re in a relationship. You know what I see when I look around? I see a room full of great people. So let’s give ourselves a break. We are a community, and as long as we have each other, we’re never truly alone.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: That was cool. What you said.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You really think so?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you. Uh, would you like to, uh, get a cup, a cup of coffee or…?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Later, losers!

utterance.content: Hello? Another medical emergency? What’s wrong with him now? I seriously doubt he was bitten by a Chinese bird spider. How exactly does a bump feel Asian? Just put him on the phone. Sheldon, I am not driving over there again. Because I drove over there yesterday for a brain tumour that turned out to be an ice cream headache. Yes, I still want to be your emergency contact. Yes, you can eat your ice cream too fast and also have a brain tumour. I’m on my way. Brain tumour would explain a lot.
